dogs.name: Rabies Vaccine
dogs.description: Protects against the rabies virus, which is fatal and can be transmitted to humans. Typically required by law.

dogs.name: Distemper Vaccine
dogs.description: Protects against the canine distemper virus, a serious disease affecting the respiratory, gastrointestinal, and nervous systems.
dogs.recommended_reschedule: Initial series at 6, 10, and 14 weeks, then annual booster

dogs.name: Adenovirus Type 1 (CAV-1)
dogs.description: Protects against canine hepatitis, which affects the liver.
dogs.recommended_reschedule: Part of initial puppy vaccination series, then annual booster

dogs.name: Adenovirus Type 2 (CAV-2)
dogs.description: Often combined with CAV-1 to provide protection against respiratory infections.
dogs.recommended_reschedule: Part of initial puppy vaccination series, then annual booster

dogs.name: Parvovirus Vaccine
dogs.description: Protects against canine parvovirus, a highly contagious and potentially deadly gastrointestinal disease.
dogs.recommended_reschedule: Initial series at 6, 10, and 14 weeks, then annual booster

dogs.name: Parainfluenza Virus
dogs.description: Usually included in combination vaccines; protects against a respiratory virus causing kennel cough.
dogs.recommended_reschedule: Part of initial puppy vaccination series, then annual booster

dogs.name: Leptospirosis Vaccine
dogs.description: Protects against Leptospira bacteria, which can cause liver and kidney damage and can be transmitted to humans.
dogs.recommended_reschedule: Initial two-dose series, then annual booster

dogs.name: Bordetella Bronchiseptica Vaccine
dogs.description: Commonly recommended for dogs frequently in contact with other dogs (e.g., boarding, dog parks); helps prevent kennel cough.
dogs.recommended_reschedule: Can be annual or semi-annual depending on exposure risk

dogs.name: Lyme Disease Vaccine
dogs.description: Protects against Borrelia burgdorferi, transmitted by ticks; recommended for dogs in high-risk areas.
dogs.recommended_reschedule: Initial two-dose series, then annual booster

dogs.name: Canine Influenza Vaccine
dogs.description: Protects against strains of canine flu that cause respiratory illness.
dogs.recommended_reschedule: Initial two-dose series, then annual booster

dogs.name: Coronavirus Vaccine
dogs.description: Protects against canine coronavirus (different from COVID-19); typically less recommended due to low severity.

dogs.name: Canine Herpesvirus Vaccine
dogs.description: Used in specific breeding scenarios to prevent neonatal death.
dogs.recommended_reschedule: Specific to breeding females, consult veterinarian

dogs.name: DHPP/DAPP
dogs.description: A common combination vaccine that covers Distemper, Hepatitis, Parvovirus, and Parainfluenza.
dogs.recommended_reschedule: Initial series at 6, 10, and 14 weeks, then annual booster

dogs.name: DA2PP
dogs.description: Another typical combination vaccine covering Distemper, Adenovirus Type 2, Parvovirus, and Parainfluenza.
dogs.recommended_reschedule: Initial series at 6, 10, and 14 weeks, then annual booster

cats.name: Rabies Vaccine
cats.description: Protects against the rabies virus, which is fatal and can be transmitted to humans. Typically required by law.

cats.name: Feline Herpesvirus (FHV-1) Vaccine
cats.description: Protects against feline viral rhinotracheitis, a major cause of upper respiratory infections.
cats.recommended_reschedule: Initial series at 6, 10, and 14 weeks, then annual booster

cats.name: Feline Calicivirus (FCV) Vaccine
cats.description: Protects against calicivirus, which causes respiratory illness and oral disease.
cats.recommended_reschedule: Initial series at 6, 10, and 14 weeks, then annual booster

cats.name: Feline Panleukopenia Virus (FPV) Vaccine
cats.description: Also known as the feline distemper vaccine; protects against a highly contagious and potentially fatal disease affecting the immune system and gastrointestinal tract.
cats.recommended_reschedule: Initial series at 6, 10, and 14 weeks, then annual booster

cats.name: Feline Leukemia Virus (FeLV) Vaccine
cats.description: Recommended for cats that go outdoors or live with other cats; protects against a virus that can cause immunosuppression and cancer.
cats.recommended_reschedule: Initial two-dose series, then annual booster for at-risk cats

cats.name: Feline Immunodeficiency Virus (FIV) Vaccine
cats.description: Protects against FIV, which causes immunosuppression; typically recommended for cats with a higher risk of exposure.
cats.recommended_reschedule: Initial two-dose series, consult veterinarian for follow-up

cats.name: Chlamydia Felis Vaccine
cats.description: Protects against Chlamydia felis, which can cause conjunctivitis and respiratory issues.
cats.recommended_reschedule: Initial two-dose series, then annual booster if recommended

cats.name: Bordetella Bronchiseptica Vaccine
cats.description: Recommended for cats in multi-cat environments or those frequently exposed to other cats; helps prevent respiratory infection.

cats.name: Feline Infectious Peritonitis (FIP) Vaccine
cats.description: Controversial and less commonly administered; protects against a virus that can cause a fatal immune response in cats.

cats.name: FVRCP
cats.description: A common combination vaccine that covers Feline Viral Rhinotracheitis, Calicivirus, and Panleukopenia.
cats.recommended_reschedule: Initial series at 6, 10, and 14 weeks, then annual booster
